SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

jam.data
Class Histogram

java.lang.Object
  jam.data.Histogram
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class containing spectra and the routines to perform operations on them.

Each histogram has:

  • name
  • type--the double types are not yet fully implemented
    • ONE_DIM_INT
    • TWO_DIM_INT
    • ONE_DIM_DOUBLE
    • TWO_DIM_DOUBLE
  • size
  • title
  • axis labels, x and y
  • data array 1 or 2 dimension
  • gates

Modified 2/11/99 Dale Visser to have an error array too. By default, the class will assume Poisson error bars and return square root of counts. For Histograms produced by adding, subtracting, or otherwise manipulating other histograms, though, an appropriate error array should be calculated and stored by invoking the setErrors() method.

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.5, 1.0
Author:
Ken Swartz, Dale Visser
See Also:
setErrors(double[]), Serialized Form

NAME_LENGTH

public static final int NAME_LENGTH
Maximum number of characters in the histogram name.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

errorsSet

protected boolean errorsSet
Set to true if errors are set explicitly. Put in place so as not to waste disk space on saved files. IO routines should only write out error bars when this is set to true (checked by calling errorsSet(). Otherwise, Poisson errors should be assumed by other software.

See Also:
errorsSet()

errors

protected double[] errors
Array which contains the errors in the channel counts.

Constructor Detail

Histogram

public Histogram(java.lang.String nameIn,
                 int type,
                 int sizeX,
                 int sizeY,
                 java.lang.String title)
          throws DataException
Master constructor invoked by all other constructors.

Parameters:
nameIn - unique name of histogram, should be limited to NAME_LENGTH characters, used in both .jhf and .hdf files as the unique identifier for reloading the histogram
type - type and dimensionality of data
sizeX - number of channels in x-axis
sizeY - number of channels in y-axis
title - lengthier title of histogram, displayed on plot
See Also:
NAME_LENGTH, ONE_DIM_INT, TWO_DIM_INT, ONE_DIM_DOUBLE, TWO_DIM_DOUBLE

Histogram

public Histogram(java.lang.String nameIn,
                 int type,
                 int size,
                 java.lang.String title)
          throws DataException
Contructor with no number given, but axis labels are given.

Parameters:
nameIn - unique name of histogram, should be limited to NAME_LENGTH characters, used in both .jhf and .hdf files as the unique identifier for reloading the histogram
type - dimensionality of histogram, 1 or 2
size - number of channels, all 2d histograms have square dimensions
title - lengthier title of histogram, displayed on plot

Histogram

public Histogram(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 int[][] countsIn)
          throws DataException
Create a new 2-d histogram with counts known and automatically give it a number

Parameters:
name - unique name of histogram, should be limited to NAME_LENGTH characters, used in both .jhf and .hdf files as the unique identifier for reloading the histogram
title - lengthier title of histogram, displayed on plot
countsIn - array of counts to initialize with, must be square
Throws:
DataException - thrown if non-square array in parameter list

public final int getNumber()
Returns the number of the histogram, mostly used for export to ORNL files. Histograms should always be assigned unique numbers.

Returns:
the number of this histogram

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of this histogram type. This can be:
  • ONE_DIM_INT
  • TWO_DIM_INT
  • ONE_DIM_DOUBLE
  • TWO_DIM_DOUBLE

Returns:
the type
See Also:
ONE_DIM_INT, TWO_DIM_INT, ONE_DIM_DOUBLE, TWO_DIM_DOUBLE

setNumber

public void setNumber(int n)
Sets the number of this histogram.

Parameters:
n - the desired number for the histogram

getCounts

public java.lang.Object getCounts()
Returns the counts in the histogram as an array of the appropriate type. It is necessary to cast the returned array as follows:
  • ONE_DIM_INT cast with (int [])
  • TWO_DIM_INT cast with (int [][])
  • ONE_DIM_DOUBLE cast with (double [])
  • TWO_DIM_DOUBLE cast with (double [][])

Returns:
Object which must be cast as indicated above

setZero

public void setZero()
Zeroes all the counts in this histogram.

public Gate[] getGates()
Returns the list of gates that belong to this histogram.

Returns:
the list of gates that belong to this histogram

public void inc(int dataWord)
         throws DataException

                int dataWordY)
